item.title: UKRA Annual General Meeting - 2022
item.description:
United Kingdom Rocketry Association Annual General Meeting (2022)

Date/time: 8PM Wednesday, 16th November 2022

Method: Zoom meeting (link to follow)

 

Dear UKRA Members,

The UKRA Council is pleased to announce the 2022 Annual General Meeting. Following the record attendance at last year’s meeting we will again be holding the meeting online via Zoom.

The link will be posted, and provided directly to all UKRA Members via email, prior to the meeting with the agenda and any other papers.

Nominations for Council positions are requested – to be communicated to the Secretary prior to the AGM, or at the AGM. The Constitution provides for eight Council Members.

At present we have eight members –

Chair – Paul Carter (Safety & Technical Committee Member)
Vice Chair – Stuart Livings
Secretary – Andy Calver (Safety & Technical Committee Member)
Treasurer – Mike Hoffman
Ronald Hatcher
Ben Jarvis
Aaron McNeil
Daniel Innes (resigned September 2022
Ian Lewis (from September 2022)

The AGM can hear, consider, and vote on alterations for changes to the Constitution.

Proposals for any such changes should be communicated to the Secretary in writing (letter or e-mail, or letter attached with e-mail) at least two (2) weeks prior to the AGM.

For full details pertaining to the AGM arrangements and rules – which include provision for on-line AGM and voting – please see Section 5 of the UKRA Constitution at - http://ukra.org.uk/aboutus

Please support UKRA and its purposes through active participation in this year’s AGM.

This announcement will also be sent to UKRA members by e-mail to the address we hold. If you have changed your email address and not informed UKRA please contact membership@ukra.org.uk

Andy Calver
UKRA Secretary

Tags: 
ukra agm
item.dc:creator: Stuart

item.title: UKRA Membership and Certification Updates
item.description:
Dear UKRA membership and members to be,

As a result of feedback we have graciously received on the membership and certification processes we have made some interim improvements to simplify the administration and therefore minimise the time it takes for you to receive your membership cards and certificates.

This is an interim step until we are able to bring a fully online membership system into service.

Therefore please note the following:

  1. There are new membership and certification documents on the UKRA website.  Effective immediately, only these documents will be accepted for membership, certification or RSO changes.
  2. At all times the member (or pending member) is responsible for their documentation, including getting the right signatures and submitting the documentation to UKRA.  Your RSO is not responsible for your paperwork, only for providing their details, comments and approval.
  3. All certification documents now require RSO details including an RSO signature.
  4. Non-UKRA members wishing to obtain certification (typically Level 1) MUST fill in a separate membership form with their certification.
  5. Payment for memberships MUST be sent directly to UKRA in accordance with the instructions on the forms.  Membership and certification payments may no longer be proxied by clubs or RSOs.

While this may seem a little draconian please do understand that these changes are for your benefit, as they will reduce the confusion and time taken to resolve membership and certification changes.

For events that the current membership administrator (Naomi Mildenhall) is attending please feel free to talk to her regarding your membership enquiries or for submission of your paperwork.  In all other circumstances please ensure that you have fully completed your paperwork before you leave site, including all relevant signatures, and then email membership@ukra.org.uk for the next steps.

Tags: 
membership
certification
ukra
item.dc:creator: Stuart

item.title: UKRA Council Announcement
item.description:
UKRA Council Announcement

Dear members,

We are pleased to announce that the new UKRA Council had its first meeting last night (5th October 2021)

Attendee’s.
Chairman: Paul Carter
Deputy Chairman: Stuart Livings
Secretary: Andy Calver
Treasurer: Michael Hoffman
Ron Hatcher
Aaron McNeil
Daniel Innes
Apologies: Ben Jarvis
Agenda
1. Personal interest & Conflict of interest
2. Membership
3. Code of Conduct

The Chair opened the meeting

Item 1) All parties present gave an overview of personal interest & conflict of interest.

Item 2) It is fully understood that the current system is not working as it should. It was agreed by all parties that there is a requirement for a more automated approach.
A sub-committee has been formed headed by Ron Hatcher to look at what is available off the shelf and report back to the committee within a month.

Naomi Mildenhall will operate the existing membership going forward. However, Andy Calver has agreed to continue with membership admin until they arrange a handover. Further updates on the existing process will be forthcoming (timescale 2-3 weeks approx)

Item 3) A code of conduct is a main priority of the Executive. The Chair gave an overview to the council of what he believes in. The Chair stated that the council is here for the benefit of UKRA, the growth of UKRA, the growth of UK armature rocketry, its members and the wilder rocketry community. Council members should put UKRA first in all their dealings when representing UKRA. No council member should be using their position on UKRA for any personal gain whatsoever. This was fully accepted by the all parties present.
A sub-committee has been formed headed by Mike Hoffman and report back to the committee within a month.

AOB) Mike Hoffman gave an overview of his current understanding regarding the UKRA bank account and looking at alternative banks/bank accounts.

Close of meeting

Kind Regards
UKRA Council

Tags: 
Council
meeting
item.dc:creator: PaulCarter

item.title: UKRA Council Announcement
item.description:
UKRA Council Announcement

Dear members,

We are pleased to announce that the new UKRA Council roles are as follows.

Chairman: Paul Carter
Deputy Chairman: Stuart Livings
Secretary: Andy Calver
Treasurer: Michael Hoffman

Membership: TBA
S&T: Unchanged at present

Again, we would ask the membership for its patience during this initial handover period. Please be assured we will update the membership shortly once additional meetings have taken place.

Kind Regards

UKRA Council

item.title: UKRA 2021 AGM Election results
item.description:
The new UKRA Council thanks everyone for voting at yesterday's AGM and offers specific gratitude to John Bonsor and Michael Williams for their contribution to make UKRA what it is today. The new council comprises: Aaron McNeil, Andy Calver, Ben Jarvis, Daniel Innes, Michael Hoffman, Paul Carter, Ronald Hatcher and Stuart Livings.

The Council asks for patience during the transition period and assures all members that updates on the individual Council positions will be published forthwith.

news

item.title: UKRA AGM
item.description:
Dear Member/s,

The UKRA AGM will be held this Wednesday 29th of September 2021 @ 7pm, by Zoom.

Later this evening, all members registered on the UKRA database will be emailed a link to the AGM Zoom meeting.

Should any member have not received the email by tomorrow morning (please check your spam folder) and then contact UKRA via the enquires email and a link will be sent to you.

We hope you will join us for the meeting.

Kind Regards

UKRA Council

item.title: Midland Sky 2021 National Rockery Weekend Event
item.description:
Midland Sky National Rocket Weekend Event is Almost Here!!!!

Dates: 18th – 19th September 2021
Camping and set up from 5.30pm on the Friday night (17th)

On-site vendor = Wizard Rocketry & Rockets & Things

On Site Facilities: Camping, Toilets, Marquee + Prep Area, Plus Free Hot Water, Free Tables, Free Marque, Free parking (all subject to availability)
We hope very much that you will come and join us here at our excellent flying site in the Midlands!!!

Event/Flight Registration:
We accept cash or PayPal (friends & family) or pay the additional fees
Attendee Info Link = https://www.midlandrocketry.org.uk/copy-of-midland-sky-2020
Event Costing Link = https://www.midlandrocketry.org.uk/midland-sky-2018

Cert Flights:
Please remember to bring your sim’s with you. Please go to the UKRA website and download and print the appropriate paperwork to bring with you
Cert Link = http://www.ukra.org.uk/hprcerts
Spectator Fee: Per Person Day Rate = £10
Camping: £10 per tent or £5 per person (multi sharing)

Please keep an eye out for up-dates
We fly from our Twycross site just a few miles from Junction 11 of the M42 and around 15 miles from Junction 24 of the M1 Postcode
CV9 3QH

When you travel through the farmyard to get to the flying field, please drive very slowly 5 mph (walking pace) as there are often children and dogs in the yard.
For any questions or further information please get in touch via the contact page or call Paul on 07415 698420
Regards
Paul

midlandrocketry.org.uk
Rocket Launches | Midland Rocketry | United Kingdom
Model Rocketry, Highpowered Rocketry, Rocketry Workshops, STEM, Education, UKROC, CANSAT, Rocketry Launches, Midland Rocketry, United Kingdom, Teleivision Production, Film Production, Hybrid Rocketry

Tags: 
Midland Sky 2021
National Rockery Weekend Event

item.title: Notam's
item.description:
Hi all,
I had an email from AROps advising they are no longer accepting NOTAM requests on the previous forms. They have moved to an online system.

Message reads as below:

Please complete all future Notam requests using the following website and bookmark this link for future use:

https://apply.caa.co.uk/CAAPortal/terms-and-conditions.htm?formCode=BAL

The advantages of the online system are that the resulting submission will generate an Application Submission Number that can then be quickly tracked by us on our system, should you need request an update on the status, as it moves through, from initial submission, plotting, deconfliction, assessment and then if necessary issuing of a NOTAM, or permission /airspace co-ordination notices. In addition, a copy of the submission can be emailed to yourself at the end for retention.

Please submit These, and all future requests, using the above link.

Regards

AROps
Airspace Regulation (Utilisation) Operations
Civil Aviation Authority
01293 983 880.
Office Hours: Monday to Friday 0830 – 1630.
Please consider the environment. Think before printing this email.

Tags: 
Notam
Update
change of process
item.dc:creator: PaulCarter

item.title: AGM 2021 by Zoom
item.description:
UKRA AGM 2021, Wednesday 29th September, by Zoom.
Dear UKRA Members.
The UKRA Council is pleased to announce the 2021 AGM. To enable maximum participation, particularly in the current COVID-19 situation, the AGM will be held by Zoom. The link for that will be posted, and provided directly to all UKRA Members, in due time before the AGM, along with the evening time for the AGM, and the Agenda.
A mechanism to enable clear and fair voting at the AGM on Zoom will be announced in due time.
Nominations for Council positions are requested – to be communicated to the Secretary prior to the AGM, or at the AGM. The Constitution provides for eight. At present we have five (5) members -
Chair – Michael Williams
Vice Chair - Vacant
Secretary – John Bonsor
Treasurer – Vacant
Membership Secretary – Andy Calver
Paul Carter – Ordinary Council Member (Safety & Technical Committee Member)
Mike Hoffman – Ordinary Council Member
Current Council Members may stand for re-election.
The AGM can hear, consider, and vote on alterations for changes to the Constitution. Proposals for any such changes should be communicated to the Secretary in writing (letter or e-mail, or letter attached with e-mail) at least two (2) weeks prior to the AGM.
For full details pertaining to the AGM arrangements and rules – which include provision for on-line AGM and voting – please see Section 5 of the UKRA Constitution at -
http://www.ukra.org.uk/docs/mem_docs/Constitution_v42_Oct_2017.pdf
The Council apologises that there was no AGM in 2020. That was partly due to COVID-19 concerns, Hence the decision to try holding this year’s AGM by Zoom – a facility that many of us have become rather familiar with this past year or so. As there was no AGM in 2020 this year’s one is all the more important for the future of UKRA in its rocketry supporting and advisory role. Please support UKRA and its purposes through active participation in this year’s AGM. This announcement is also being sent to UKRA members by direct e-mail.
item.dc:creator: MichaelWilliams

item.title: Calling all RSO's
item.description:
Hi all RSO's,

I recently sent out an email to all RSO's using the existing UKRA RSO list, as I am currently doing a sanity check. However, I have had a number of bounce backs which is understandable as people change jobs or providers.

We are trying to establish who is still active within the rocketry community and I would really appreciate it if all RSO's would kindly (if you haven't already done so) reply to me by email at paul@rocketmotors.co.uk or PM with your correct email.

1) If you are still an active flyer
2) If you are still and active RSO
3) What club (if any) you associate yourself with.

Kind Regards

Paul Carter
UKRA Safety & Technical
07415 698420
item.dc:creator: PaulCarter
